message_1: Consider the message "HELLO WORLD" to be encrypted using a rail fence transposition cipher with three levels. What is the encrypted message and how would you decrypt it back to the original message?
message_2:
A rail fence transposition cipher with three levels arranges the letters of the message in a zigzag pattern along three horizontal lines. To encrypt the message "HELLO WORLD", we arrange the letters as follows:

H . . . O . . . R . . .
. E . L . W . L . D .
. . L . . . O . . . .

Now, we read the letters along the lines from left to right and top to bottom to get the encrypted message: HOR ELWLDO LLO

To decrypt the message back to the original message, we follow the same zigzag pattern and place the letters from the encrypted message back into the pattern:

H . . . O . . . R . . .
. E . L . W . L . D .
. . L . . . O . . . .

Finally, we read the letters along the zigzag pattern to get the original message: HELLO WORLD
